In political geography, a '''regional state''' is a [[Sovereign state|state]] more [[centralized]] than a [[federation]], but less centralized than a [[unitary state]]. Regional states include federations in which power has become more centralized, and unitary states in which some power has been [[Devolution|devolved]] to regional governments. This term has yet to become widely used.
